title: For real though, Fiora gets a paragraph!

replies.body:
The new format for champion introductions will be done for every new Champion and every updated Champ moving forward.There's more to come for Fiora. She, like Tahm Kench, just came in the phase as we transition and test things out (as well as making sure things are ready for Bilgewater: Burning Tides), but both she and Tahm will be getting the same treatment on the website that TF, Graves and Gangplank have received so far.

Miss Fortune will be next.

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=nfkXKAwr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-07-26T05:52:04.314+0000)
>
> The new format for champion introductions will be done for every new Champion and every updated Champ moving forward.There's more to come for Fiora. She, like Tahm Kench, just came in the phase as we transition and test things out (as well as making sure things are ready for Bilgewater: Burning Tides), but both she and Tahm will be getting the same treatment on the website that TF, Graves and Gangplank have received so far.
> 
> Miss Fortune will be next.

Do you mean all updated champions? IE, singed was visually updated but not gameplay or lore. What about champions whose lore is Broken like Lee Sin, or more egregiously, Fiddlesticks and Nocturne. How far back are you going with your lore updates following updated champions. Master Yi was pretty heavily iterated on. What about Ekko? 

What I am more asking for is guidelines on whose getting what. I do have faith that you'll get to everyone eventually (I've got this cool idea that Noxus is gonna run into a civil war hearalded by the Du Couteau family and Riven Versus the Seedy and Corrupt Black rose, power through merit v power through deception, with Darius as a split(heh) vote.) I am also excited with the love Zaun has been getting lately and I think everyone's favorite goo ball, besides twitch, could use a bit of lore love.

  But, what are Riots current Lore goals? You've got your new long form entries, which are awesome, but how far back into the updates do they go? What level of update gets a lore pass? How far back into the "New Champions" list do these lore updates go? How prioritized are finishing the current story threads left by Shurima and more egregiously Fjrelord?

I mean all Champions. We aim to produce written character introductions that are of the same format as seen with GP, TF, and Graves for every single Champ. Our priorities are based on Champions who are going to be involved in updates of any kind, new Champs, Champions with contradictory backgrounds and those being used in Events such as Bilgewater and other projects.

For example, Fiora received her update, so we put together her new introduction. Bilgewater was in production, so we did new intros for TF, Graves, GP and MF. Singed is one of our Champions with an outdated history, so we're working on him.

Also, these introductions are not necessarily the best place to further stories alone. For example, when Miss Fortune's intro comes out, it will cover the events of Burning Tides: The Reckoning, but the best way to understand those events is to read the story itself. 

We want to create stories for our Champions that have different "zoom" levels. You want a quick idea of who they are and what they do? In-client character introduction is the place. Want more of an overview of how they became who they are? Go to the website and read their background. Want to get a feel for their personality in the story world? Read the flavor text on the website that accompanies the background.

Want to see them alive and interacting with the world, to get a really good idea of their thoughts and personality in the moments that they are developing? Read/watch/listen to the stories.

Make sense?

Since you are the only Rioter i usually see on the boards... Do you mind taking a Quick peek at the Skins anc Champion Concept page for me? MY post is about Amumu and you seem to have quite the impressive judgement.
You say "read/watch/listen to the stories".Does this implies that you guys at Riot are also going to include lore videos & narrations as well as text stories on the website?

I like most of the current lore, bar Twisted Fate and the already well conveyed anger at how you butchered his lore to the point we don't even know if he had magic all the time or not and why he betrayed Graves when it was cut, dry, and made perfect sense.

But, here's the thing. Why the flying fuck should I care, jaredan? How does Burning Tides impact the rest of Runeterra? How does this further the narrative of League of Legends? Is this Dagger the Order of the Shadow Dagger that GP jacked, and now T.F is stealing it for...Miss Fortune? Someone else?

How is Burning Tides going to impact Runeterra as a whole?



Because if it doesn't, then all this work can literally be ignored. Why should I care Graves and T.F just butchered like a quarter of Gangplank's forces when that won't ever impact a later fight? Will this ever be mentioned again?


How, Jaredan, is this story going to impact the world without a map?

> How, Jaredan, is this story going to impact the world without a map?

Does it really need to? Not every story needs global implications. This isn't a war between nations or a global catastrophe, it's a very personal affair; a score to be settled between two men that crossed another, highly influential one with a certain woman lingering in the background, perhaps having orchestrated it all. 

The impact isn't global, its local and its individual. It's about Gangplank, Miss Fortune, Twisted Fate and Graves; those four and those tied to them in whatever way be it those who fight with them or who die by their hands. The world won't change much, but the lives of these four will be affected. If you don't care about them and their goals and whatever, then you don't have to and shouldn't force yourself care.

I care about Miss Fortune, but if the world narrative is going to be 10 independant stories that have no correlation or overarching plot, then it's not a narrative.

It's a fucking newspaper about current events.

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=nfkXKAwr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-07-26T05:52:04.314+0000)

>

Alrighty... Time to be "that guy."

How soon before {{champion:27}} gets his story fixed?  You did mention him [last month](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/khkWEbWQ-what-the-hell-is-the-lore-team-getting-paid-for?comment=005b) in preparation for this new lore format.
It'll be after the Bilgewater event and when we're happy with it. Those are the two main deciding factors.
Any plans for the rest of Shurima and thr Shadow Isles champions? I assume they would have priority after Tahm and MF, since they also lost paragraphs.

Hey Jaredan, will Fiora (Or MF for that matter) be getting a few additional lines of dialog along with her VU? The expanded script for every new character really gives them a lot of depth and personality and it would be great to see those characters improve in that respect. It'd be unfortunate to see them left untouched given that its unlikely they'll be revisited after their rework is finished.

Is her extended lore on the main page or do we still wait?

I'm crying inside Jaredan, because it seems like you want to remove all of the context that champion bio's previously had. It seems like Riot doesn't wan't to have a cohesive narrative lore.

Most of the new lore that is being created seems like it it is being created with the intention that it will fit within the new lore's framework no matter what is produced. 

This model produces shitty lore. It it is c;urrently producing that shitty lore.

Riot. I hope you make a stand and start and produce qualityh lore....but you probably wont. 

What matters is that you tried John!.

John. you Tried. 

Night! 1:02
I dunno what's new in that paragraph, i've read this before >.>

> [{quoted}](name=searchman15,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=nfkXKAwr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-26T02:45:03.569+0000)
>
> I dunno what's new in that paragraph, i've read this before >.>

The point is that they intend on working her story and give her some extended lore.

Well, the fact that T.F, Graves, and Gangplank ACTUALLY got their extended lores, complete with short stories at the end showcasing them on a normal day (for them) does give me some hope for the future.

Here's hoping that the Bilgewater event is the start of the Lore Team redeeming themselves. C'mon Jaredan, I wanna believe.

As excited as i am for it im still in a odd place with Fiora, i actually played her a ton and LOVE her, but i feel like the VU Just destroyed her :/ 

Playing her royal guard skin and her alot this weekend  ( or at least trying to ) as a last hurrah before before she gets torn down. Hope her lore is awesome though.
